Job Title: Security Officer 1

Location: Bluefield, WV

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Welcome! We’re excited you’re considering an opportunity with us! To apply to this position and be considered, click the Apply button located above this message and complete the application in full. Below, you’ll find other important information about this position.       Additional Job Description: 
POSITION SUMMARY: Performs a variety of duties to provide assistance and information to all patients, visitors and staff. Enforce PCH policies and procedures to provide a safe, secure environment. 
 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS IF HIRED AFTER MAY 1, 2022: 
EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION, AND/OR LICENSURE: 
1. High School diploma or equivalent 
2. Valid Driver’s License – Must be maintained during employment period. 
3. Obtain certification in HeartSaver First Aid within 60 days of hire date. 
 
 
 
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
EXPERIENCE: 
1. Prior experience in the Security field 
 
 
CORE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The statements described here are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this position. They are not intended to be constructed as an all-inclusive list of all responsibilities and duties. Other duties may be assigned. 
POSITION SUMMARY: Performs a variety of duties to provide assistance and information to all patients, visitors and staff. Enforce PCH policies and procedures to provide a safe, secure environment. 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS IF HIRED PRIOR TO MAY 1, 2022: 
EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION, AND/OR LICENSURE: 
1. Valid Driver’s License – Must be maintained during employment period. 
2. Obtain certification in HeartSaver First Aid within 60 days of hire date. 
1. Initiates positive customer service interaction and provides appropriate assistance to hospital patients, visitors and staff to facilitate orderly and efficient access to facilities in accordance with PCH and departmental policies and procedures. 
2. Maintains consistent visibility and presence at assigned locations to provide an information and directional resource for all patients, visitors and staff distributing accurate information to all who request such 100% of the time. 
3. Responds to all patient, visitor and staff requests for information/assistance in a caring, courteous manner, 100% of the time. 
4. Provides physical assistance, wheelchair assistance, transport services, escort services and room access patients, visitors and staff accessing facilities. 
5. Monitors and maintains traffic flow in parking areas and roadways by assisting disabled vehicles, issuing parking permits and warning violations. 
6. Protects people and property by assisting in the prevention of accidents, theft and vandalism, in accordance with PCH and department policies and procedures, as monitored by supervision. 
7. Maintains consistent presence and visibility by performing routine building rounds, building door unlocks, exterior building and parking lot patrol. 
8. Makes recommendations to management, staff, visitors and patients to improve security and prevent accidents and crime. 
9. Reports suspicious situations, circumstances, incidents and persons, according to PCH and department policy and procedures. 
10. Responds and provides assistance to patients, visitors and staff during fire and disaster drills, animal control issues, transportation of valuables, and lost/found issues, according to PCH and department policy and procedures. 
11. Provides written documentation of activities, incidents, premises safety, accidents, theft, vandalism and other data requested by supervision in a factual, objective, and legible manner. 
12. Responds to and provides assistance to patients, visitors and staff during emergency situations such as; assaults, domestic disputes, fire, vandalism, bomb threats, theft, vehicle accidents, disasters, etc. 
13. Operates Hospital-owned vehicles in a safe and responsible manner, 100% of the time. 
14. Ensures safety and proper operating condition of vehicles by performing vehicle inspections, as outlined by departmental policy. 
 
 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
1. Ability to sit, stand and walk for the entire shift and/or double shift. 
2. Ability to lift, push or pull 80 pounds. 
3. Ability to tolerate adverse environmental conditions for entire shift and/or double shift. 
4. Evaluation by Occupational Medicine required upon hire or transfer to ensure medical fitness. Periodic evaluation after hire required. Any significant changes in health-status must be reported. 
 
 
WORKING ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
1. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee may frequently be exposed to outside weather conditions. 
 
SKILLS & ABILITIES: 
1. Ability to perform effectively under often stressful situations. 
2. Good decision making skills. 
3. Ability to organize and maintain document controls. 
4. Demonstrates writing skills. 
5. Must be a team player. 
6. Displays caring and courteous attitude 
7. Ability to maintain confidentiality. 
8. Maintains accurate documentation. 
Must be able to communicate clearly and respond logically to various situations.  Scheduled Weekly Hours:   36 Shift:  Varied (United States of America) Exempt/Non-Exempt: United States of America (Non-Exempt) Company:   PCH Princeton Community Hospital Cost Center: 7308 PCH Security Bluefield Address:  1333 Southview Drive  Bluefield  West Virginia

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
